properties.headline: Mardi Gras Parade - Saturday 6 March - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.otherAdvice:
Mardi Gras Parade at the Sydney Cricket Ground from 6pm until 10pm. Gates open from 4pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as attendees travel to and from the SCG. 

Driver Ave will be closed from Lang Rd to the NRL building on the northern end of Driver Avenue from 12pm until 11.30pm for the event. 

The Moore Park Rd Bondi exit from the Eastern Distributor will be closed from 9.30pm until 11pm for the safety of crowds leaving the stadium. Motorists can use the Randwick exit during this time.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm until midnight on roads in and around Moore Park including sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK - SATURDAY 6 MARCH

FROM 3PM UNTIL MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 28 February - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Wellington Phoenix at McDonald Jones Stadium from 6:10pm until 8pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW Interactive road closure and clearway map

properties.headline: L'Etape cycle ride - Saturday 20 March - KIAMA TO BERRY VIA SHOALHAVEN HEADS, BOMADERRY,  KANGAROO VALLEY, ROBERTSON, JAMBEROO Princes Hwy, Gerroa Road, Bolong Road, Moss Vale Road, Illawarra Hwy, Sheepwash Road, Jamberoo Mountain Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Lâ€™Etape Australia cycle ride will be taking place on Saturday 20 March along 181km of roads from Kiama to Berry through Shoalhaven and the Southern Highlands Including Gerringong, Berry, Kangaroo Valley, Bomaderry and Jamberoo. There are two events - The 80km Ride and The 136km Race.

Key roads along the course will begin closing from 4am. Roads progressively reopen as riders complete the stages of each course. Access for local residents and general motorists will be managed by traffic control at designated crossover points when safe to do so while the event is underway.

KEY CLOSURE TIMES:

From 4am: 

  • Kiama - sections of Manning St, Terralong St and Blowhole Point Rd closed until 8.30am. Note sections of Manning St will close from 1am until 5pm for event start / finish areas. Managed access across Manning St via Barney St crossover point.
  • South Kiama - sections of South Kiama Drive approaching Princes Hwy closed until 9am. South Kiama Dr and Saddleback Mountain Rd closed until 5pm.
  • Princes Hwy between Kiama and Gerringong - Contraflow traffic arrangements will be in place until 10.30am with one lane of traffic maintained in each direction on the Princes Hwy using the northbound lanes with a speed limit reduction of 40km/h in effect. All southbound lanes will be closed.

From 5am

  • Berry / Berry Mountain - Queen St, Kangaroo Valley Rd and Prince Alfred St closed until 11am. Sections of Station Rd and Alexandra St closed until 2pm for ride finish area. Managed access across Queen St via Alexandra St and across Kangaroo Valley Rd at Huntingdale Park Rd crossover points. A section of Alexandra St will close from 1am for event finish line set up. 
  • Gerringong / Gerroa - Fern St, Crooked River Rd and Gerroa Rd closed until 9.30am. Managed access across Fern St via Belinda St crossover point.
  • Shoalhaven Heads / Coolangatta - Coolangatta Rd closed until 2pm, Bolong Rd eastbound lanes closed until 1.30pm. Access westbound on Bolong Rd from Shoalhaven to Bomaderry maintained. 

From 5:30am: 

  • Kangaroo Valley - Moss Vale Rd, Cambewarra Lookout Rd and Tourist Rd closed until 12.30pm. Access to Kangaroo Valley via Berry from 11am to 12.30pm, and from Moss Vale via Fitzroy Falls after 2pm.
  • Fitzroy Falls / Barrengarry - Nowra Rd closed until 2pm.

From 6.30am:

  • Avoca - Sheepwash Rd closed until 2pm. Managed access to Illawarra Hwy for Burrawang/Avoca residents via Wildes Meadow Rd and Walkers Rd.

From 7am: 

  • Robertson - Illawarra Hwy closed until 3.30pm. Managed access across Illawarra Hwy at Meryla St and Caalong St crossover points. Access to Burrawang via Illawarra Hwy/Sheepwash Rd roundabout to Church St. 
  • Access between Southern Highlands and Wollongong via Macquarie Pass and Tourist Dr while Illawarra Hwy.
  • Jamberoo - Allowrie St and Jamberoo Mountain Rd closed until 5pm. Managed access to and from Jamberoo via Churchill St under stop/slow conditions. Access across Allowrie St at Minnamurra Lane crossover point. 
  • Bomaderry / Cambewarra - Cambewarra Rd, Moss Vale Rd and Railway St closed until 12.30pm. Bolong Rd eastbound lanes closed until 1.30pm. No access from Bomaderry to Shoalhaven via Bolong Rd. North and south travel across Princes Hwy at Moss Vale Rd maintained.

From 8.30am: 

  • Saddleback Mountain - Fountaindale Rd / Saddleback Mountain Rd until 5pm. 

For full road closure details and local access arrangements see our interactive map.

Special event clearways will be in effect on key roads along the course in Kiama, Berry, Robertson and Jamberoo between 1am and 5pm to provide additional lane capacity for the cyclists.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to residents with local parking permits or Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Traffic controllers and Police will be on-site at designated locations along the course to help maintain access for local residents and general motorists when safe to do so. Please see details of arrangements that will be in place along the course below or refer to the interactive map.

Berry              

  • Queen St/Alexandra St crossover from 5am to 11am - Traffic travelling to and from Berry CBD will be managed across the course by traffic control - access to Princes Hwy via Victoria St or North St maintained.
  • Huntingdale Park Rd/Kangaroo Valley Rd roundabout crossover from 5am to 11am - Traffic travelling north and south on Huntingdale Dr will be managed across the course by traffic control
  • Princes Hwy southbound off-ramp at the Berry Bypass closed from 5am to 11am. Motorists should use the southbound off ramp on the eastern end of Queen St to access Berry CBD.
  • Alexandra St closed between Victoria St and Station Rd - access managed by traffic control from 1am to 5am.
  • Station Rd closed at Albany St - Vehicle access to Berry train station managed by traffic control from 5am to 2pm.
  • Local access along Coolangatta Road / Wharf Road â€“ from 9:20am to 9:30am vehicles will be permitted to travel north to Berry.
  • Traffic permitted to travel West along Kangaroo Valley Road until 7am
  • Traffic between Prince Alfred Street & Ice Creamery Lane to be maintained using stop / slow traffic conditions after 9:30am once the end of the event has passed through the Berry Town centre.  

Bomaderry            

  • Princes Hwy / Moss Vale Rd crossover from 7am to 12.30pm â€“ Motorists travelling north and south on the Princes Hwy will be managed across the course by traffic control at the roundabout - no access onto Moss Vale Rd or Cambewarra Rd from Princes Hwy
  • Traffic control will manage left turn exit from Elvin Drive onto Moss Vale Rd for residents to access the Princes Hwy (left only at the roundabout) from 7am to 12:30pm.
  • Access to and from Bomaderry shops maintained under traffic control left turn exit only onto Cambewarra Rd - no vehicle access past Farrelly Place. Left turn only from Cambewarra Rd onto Princes Hwy. Driveway access on Princes Hwy to Bomaderry Shops also available.
  • Local managed access eastbound to Shoalhaven permitted along Bolong Road from Bomaderry until 8:30am

Burrawang       

  • Local access to Burrawang via Church St from 7am to 3.30pm - traffic control will manage access at the Illawarra Hwy/Sheepwash Rd roundabout for motorists travelling to Burrawang via the eastbound lanes of Illawarra Hwy onto Church St.
  • Exit from Burrawang from 6.30am to 2pm via Wildes Meadow Rd, right turn onto Sheepwash Rd and left turn onto Walkers Rd for access to the Illawarra Hwy.   Cambewarra/Kangaroo Valley
  • Local access permitted in both directions along Moss Vale Rd south of Cavan Rd until 7:30am. Access for NPWS vehicles from Myra Vale Rd to travel North to the Fitzroy Falls Visitor Centre until 8:15am.

Kiama

  • Manning St / Barney St crossover â€“ motorists will be managed across the course on Manning St by traffic control from 4am to 8.30am.
  • Access to Kiama boat ramp managed under traffic control via Terralong St at Railway Pde from 4am to 8.30am.
  • Local residents in Hillview Circuit will have access to and from their properties after 9am under the direction of traffic controllers and Police when itâ€™s safe to do so. 

Kiama to Gerringong - Princes Highway            

  • Princes Hwy changed traffic conditions between Kiama and Gerringong from 4am to 10.30am. Contraflow traffic arrangements will be in place with one lane of traffic maintained in each direction on the Princes Hwy using the northbound lanes with a speed limit reduction of 40km/h in effect. All southbound lanes will be closed.

Gerringong  

  • Fern St / Belinda St crossover from 5am to 9.30am â€“ Motorists will be managed across the course on Fern St for access to and from Werri Beach and Gerringong via Belinda St by traffic control.  

Gerroa/Seven Mile Beach

  • Access to Shoalhaven Heads via Beach Rd and Gerroa Rd from 9.30am until roads in Shoalhaven reopen at 1.30pm/2pm.

Jamberoo             

  • Churchill St / Wyalla Rd managed access from 7am to 5pm â€“ Access for motorists travelling to and from Jamberoo will be managed by traffic control under stop/slow conditions using the northbound lanes of Churchill St (southbound lanes closed).
  • Allowrie St at Minnamurra Ln cross over from 7am to 5pm - Motorists travelling north and south on the Minnamurra Lane will be managed across the course by traffic control.
  • Local managed access eastbound from Robertson Pie Shop along Jamberoo Mountain Road until 9:15am
  • Local managed access on both directions along Jamberoo Mountain Road Between Churchill Street & Daltons Road until 9:15am
  • Access along Jamberoo Rd / Allowrie Street / Churchill Street between Jamberoo Mountain Road and Fountaindale Road until 9.15am.  

Robertson              

  • Meryla St / Illawarra Hwy crossover from 7am to 3.30pm - Traffic control will manage vehicles across the course on the Illawarra Hwy.
  • Caalong St / Illawarra Hwy crossover 7am to 3.30pm - Traffic control will manage vehicles across the course on the Illawarra Hwy for access to and from Robertson
  • Hoddle Street westbound lanes to be closed between Caalong Street and The Old Road from 7am until 3:30pm. Local residents can continue to travel along Hoddle Street between Caalong Street and The Old Road in both directions using the eastbound lanes. Traffic Controllers and Police will manage traffic in both directions under stop/slow conditions.

Shoalhaven            

  • Shoalhaven to Bomaderry via Bolong Rd from 7am to 1.30pm â€“ Motorists can continue to travel from Shoalhaven to Bomaderry via Bolong Rd southbound lanes only, Left turn from Shoalhaven Rd and right turn from Northview Close onto Boolong Rd maintained. No access via Bolong Rd from Bomaderry to Shoalhaven, detour via Princes Hwy and Beach Rd.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
special event clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, it will be moved to the nearest legal parking space, you can call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on Saturday 20 March 2021 at the following times and locations:

Kiama - From 1am to 5pm:

  • Manning Street between Bong Bong St and Barney St (southbound only)
  • Manning Street between Barney St and Saddleback Mountain Rd (both sides)

Kiama - From 3am to 8.30am:

  • Manning Street between Terralong St and Bong Bong St (both sides)
  • Manning Street between Barney St and Bong Bong St (northbound only)
  • Terralong St between Railway Parade and Manning St (both sides)

Berry - From 3am to 10am:

  • Queen Street between Albany St and Prince Alfred St (both sides)

Robertson - From 5am to 2pm:

  • Hoddle St between Wallangunda St and Camp St (both sides)

Jamberoo -

  • From 5am to 2.30pm: Churchill St between Jamberoo Mountain Rd and Allowrie St (both sides)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: A-League - Tuesday 2 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Melbourne City at Bankwest Stadium from 7:05pm until 9pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads may close prior to full-time to allow crowds to safely leave the area including sections of Oâ€™Connell St, Victoria Rd and Ross St.

properties.headline: Super Rugby - Friday 5 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Western Force at Bankwest Stadium from 7:45pm until 9:30pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

An event is also being held nearby at Parramatta Park on Friday evening so rugby fans are reminded to allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early.

Roads may close prior to full-time to allow crowds to safely leave the area including sections of Oâ€™Connell St, Victoria Rd and Ross St.

properties.headline: Concert - Saturday 6 March - CRONULLA Captain Cook Drive, Elouera Road, approaching Don Lucas Reserve
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
By The C concert is taking place at the Don Lucas Reserve, Cronulla from 1pm to 9pm approx on Saturday 6 March. 

Traffic will be heavier than usual on approach to Cronulla on The Kingsway, President Ave, Captain Cook Dr and Elouera Rd. Traffic will also be heavy around Cronulla centre and motorists should allow extra travel time in the area.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrain activity around the area.

properties.headline: Triathlon - Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 February - HUSKISSON Princes Hwy approaching Jervis Bay Rd and Island Point Rd
properties.adviceB: Expect delays; Use an alternative route
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 3,000 people will take part in the annual Husky Triathlon on Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 February. Races start from White Sands Park at 6:30am both days. All roads will re-open on Saturday by 3pm and on Sunday by 1pm.

**A speed reduction to 60km/h will be enforced along Woollamia Rd, Huskisson Rd and on Jervis Bay Rd between Woollamia Rd and Huskisson Rd from 6:30am to 3pm on Saturday and from 6:30am to 1pm on Sunday. 

Access to Huskisson and Vincentia will be affected during the weekend while the event is underway and road closures are in place.

Saturday 27 February

On Saturday, access to Huskisson is via Huskisson Rd and access to Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd and Naval College Rd.

Road closures will be in place on sections of Hawke St, Bowen St, Tomerong St, Owen St and Sydney St 6:30am to 3pm.

Restricted access from Tomerong St to Jervis Bay Rd, Fairfax Rd to Woollamia Rd, Jervis Bay Rd to Fairfax Rd and Jervis Bay Rd to Woollamia Rd will be in place between 6:30am and 8am and again between 11am and 3pm. Residential access will be maintained throughout the restrictions.

Sunday 28 February

On Sunday, access to Huskisson and Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd/Naval College Rd and Island Point Rd/Wool Rd only due to closures on Huskisson Rd from Tomerong St to Jervis Bay Rd.

Road closures will be in place on sections of Huskisson Rd, Woollamia Rd, Hawke St, Currambene St, Bowen St, Seasongood Rd, Fairfax Rd, Knoll Pde, Owen St and Sydney St from 6:30am to 1pm. Residential access will be maintained throughout the restrictions

Motorists are advised to expect delays and allow extra travel time through the area over the weekend.

roads.crossStreet: Jervis Bay Rd and Island Point Rd

properties.headline: Mount Panorama 500 - Friday 26 to Sunday 28 February - BATHURST Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy approaching Mount Panorama
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds each day are expected to attend the Mount Panorama 500 motor racing event from Friday to Sunday at Mount Panorama. Gates open from 6:45am on Friday, 7am on Saturday and 8am on Sunday.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads between Sydney and Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Highway and Bells Line of Rd, and along the Mitchell Hwy from Orange, the Mid-Western Hwy from Cowra and the Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Local roads in Bathurst are also expected to be busy. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time in the area during the event.

arrangementElements.html:
BATHURST 

6AM MONDAY 12 OCTOBER UNTIL 2PM MONDAY 19 OCTOBER

  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-racing Circuit will be limited to residents and accredited vehicles 
  • Ray Bant Drive will be under managed access
  • Access to the National Motor-Racing Museum (Ray Bant Drive) will be facilitated between Monday 12 October through to Wednesday 14 October (event week), the venue will be closed to the public on event days
  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-Racing circuit via Hinton Road will closed

THURSDAY 15 OCTOBER UNTIL SUNDAY 18 OCTOBER

  • Access to Ray Bant Drive will be limited to Residents, Rydges guests/workers and accredited workers/vehicles
arrangementElements.title: Changed access arrangements

properties.displayName: Mount Panorama 500 - Friday 26 to Sunday 28 February

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 28 February - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Macarthur FC at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 28 February - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Trial Match: Wests Tigers v Sea Eagles from 5pm until 7pm approx, preliminary games from 9:45am. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from events throughout the day, particularly during the evening for the NRL trial match.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval from 4pm to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St may be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
